Binomial Test

Test whether the proportion of successes on a two-level categorical dependent variable significantly differs from a hypothesized value.

binom_calc(n, success, prob = 0.5, ...)

binom_test(data, prob = 0.5)

Arguments

n
number of observations
success
number of successes
prob
assumed probability of success on a trial
...
additional arguments passed to or from other methods
data
a numeric vector

Value

binom_test returns an object of class "binom_test". An object of class "binom_test" is a list containing the following components:

References

Hoel, P. G. 1984. Introduction to Mathematical Statistics. 5th ed. New York: Wiley.

See also

binom.test

Examples

# using calculator
binom_calc(32, 13, prob = 0.5)
#>             Binomial Test              
#>  --------------------------------------
#>   Group    N     Obs. Prop    Exp. Prop 
#>  --------------------------------------
#>     0      19      0.59375        0.500 
#>     1      13      0.40625        0.500 
#>  --------------------------------------
#> 
#> 
#>                  Test Summary                 
#>  --------------------------------------------
#>   Tail              Prob             p-value  
#>  --------------------------------------------
#>   Lower    Pr(k <= 13)               0.188543 
#>   Upper    Pr(k >= 13)               0.892336 
#>   Two      Pr(k <= 13 or k >= 19)    0.377086 
#>  --------------------------------------------

# using data set
binom_test(as.factor(hsb$female), prob = 0.5)
#>              Binomial Test              
#>  ---------------------------------------
#>   Group     N     Obs. Prop    Exp. Prop 
#>  ---------------------------------------
#>     0       91        0.455        0.500 
#>     1      109        0.545        0.500 
#>  ---------------------------------------
#> 
#> 
#>                  Test Summary                  
#>  ---------------------------------------------
#>   Tail              Prob              p-value  
#>  ---------------------------------------------
#>   Lower    Pr(k <= 109)               0.910518 
#>   Upper    Pr(k >= 109)               0.114623 
#>   Two      Pr(k <= 91 or k >= 109)    0.229247 
#>  ---------------------------------------------
